newsitem.title: SPAIN: Spain's SEPI gives Endesa sale details.
newsitem.headline: Spain's SEPI gives Endesa sale details.

text.p: Spain's state holding company SEPI provided details on Monday of the share distribution for its sale of up to 35 percent of electricity utility Endesa, which the Spanish cabinet approved on Thursday.
In a statement to the national stock market commission, SEPI said it would initially offer 260,005,599 shares, or some 25 percent of Endesa's capital, with a nominal per share value of 200 pesetas.
Retail investors will get a minimum four percent discount and employees of Endesa or SEPI will get a minimum 10 percent discount.
